number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
, 2014
												tl;dr: Good: The level design, the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ story if you're the kind that likes to speculate, and weapons not saddled by the need to be "realistic" or even balancedBad: They're not the smartest cops or looters. LOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOONG loading times. The story if the storytelling style isn't something that you can't really appreciateWherever you go, whoever you side with, you will always Brouzouf. This insane first person shooter/RPG hybrid has one of the craziest stories ever written, where the story lapses in and out of coherence and continuity, yet still works very well. The enviroments are amazing and highly inspired, and massive. Quite a feat, especially with source engine. While there is one huge loading screen at the beginning of the huge levels, they are the only ones, there are no loading screens anywhere within a level, in the the massive ones like the Headquarters or Mars. Enemies look great, although their intellegence leaves a bit to be desired. One looter blew his buddy up after shooting him with his shotgun that he was aiming at me. Well, the first one shouldn't have stood in his way anyways. Enemy spawn can be a bit of a pain, too. New Eden has a spot next to some shipping containers that spawns Federal Police whenever you're not facing, even if you're facing away but standing next to the spawn point, they'll spawn. Then shoot you. Secreta help you if they have the dreaded Bear Killer. That would mean you have the demon gun too, though. You do have it, right? Brings up another point: the weapons. Dear God those weapons. A handgun that is an effective anti-air and anti-demon cannon. A minigun good against large groups of squishy Feds, Looters, and beasts, although not the best choice for armored enemies like Interceptors. A shotgun that goes further, so much further, than a sneeze. A katana that blows people up. Even the AK knockoff has an awesome feel for it. An SMG that has two firing modes: Full and Fuller. It all comes from the magical Armory of Holding in the beginning of each level that makes you feel like you're going through a candy store with a "all you can eat" coupon. Some minor complaints. Again the AI. You've probably already know my gripes so no further. Furthering the skill tree involves randomly dropping briefcases, in which those have randomly generated technology dropped, some of them being much rarer than others. You can find S.O.B 13 easy, though if you find Cybernecromancy, go ahead and buy a lottery ticket right after. It can be a pain to unlock weapons and technology because of this. If you play on the lower difficulties, it can also be difficult to gather enough brouzouf, cold hard cash, to fund research, cyberlimbs, PSI abilities, and most importantly: weapons. This is easily remedied by not being a wimp and cranking the difficulty up: Ghost usually has you swimming in cash, particuarly if you unlock the Bear Killer and go Dues Ex Machina and Interceptor hunting with it. The AI I can forgive because the rest of the game carries it, and also because this game gets cheaper than a meal at In-N-Out during sales. The rest of the issues can be remedied or at least fixed with a bandaid by adjusting spawn rates and AI behavior. Overall, I highly recommend this game. It looks a bit dated but the design is great, the guns feel deadly, and it doesn't feel the need to limit the player in case he gets "too strong".

content:
y 31, 2015
												Messed up, confusional, mysterious, and a story hard to understand, but easy to match it up by yourself (if you're insane enough). That's why i love this game.E.Y.E: Divine Cybermancy is one of the best shooter RPG i have ever played, with a story set in a futuristic cyberpunk world and a plot full of mystery, with a gameplay that gives you great freedom of customization for your character with lots of ways to upgrade your character.Also being the game set in a distant future, there are surely some features in the game that fits this age, like the hacking system, since everything is computerized (even your mind), that will let you get into particular objectives, control your enemies, rob some money and more.Another feature of the game is the sanity meter, that is pretty much self-explanatory: you will lose sanity when you see too much strange or bad stuffs, or when your mental power is low, and when you lose too much of it, you'll start seeing and hearing random things.The game has almost infinite replayability, with  different kind of "endings"  and extra missions that you can do for the different map models, or obviously to gain more money and experience.The audio of most important dialogues is chinese, so better you put the subtitles on if you don't understand the language, to get something more about the game.For the multiplayer, there aren't much people playing into the servers, but you can surely grab some friends to play the campaign togheter (i had to use the Hamachi tool to make it run and modified some stuff in the console, since the game is powered by the Source engine).That is it. I loved the game once i understood how to play it and how to give a sense to the story, since  it's damn hard to give it a sense if you don't put together all the pieces of the puzzle, because this game is, infact, a puzzle game. EXTRA NOTE FOR WHO NEEDS: In the game's folder located into steam's one, you can find the soundtrack of the game: "Steam/SteamApps/common/EYE/EYE/sound/music". Here you'll find in order the tracks you'll hear during the game,  and the one named "qnJ"  is the most awesome one, that you'll hear for very little time during the game. You're welcome. EXTRA-EXTRA NOTE: Illuminati approves.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
y 28, 2014
												What a bizarre game.It runs on the Source engine, so if you know what that is, you know what to expect graphically.  Stylistically, though, the game certainly impresses.  The "cyber-cult" aesthetic provides for an exceptionally interesting atmosphere that serves the game very well.In terms of gameplay, it's a bit clunky, but interesting.  There's a focus on gunplay as the primary mode of combat, but options for melee and espionage exist.  There're also a myriad of powers that're interesting for the most part, although you can generally function fine without them.The game's fairly short, all things considered.  It took me 10.4 hours to complete, which involved completing some of the side missions.  Note that "side missions" aren't like most games, in that they're repeatable and don't progress side stories at all.  Don't expect a variety of NPCs whose demands will send you all over the place, but instead the ability to revisit previously completed campaign missions with a different set of objectives.  There're only 7 campaign missions (not counting the tutorial), but each is fairly lengthy.  The game supports up to 32 people at once, in both co-op and versus modes.  Yes, there's 32 player co-op.E.Y.E.'s biggest problem is its lack of explanation.  While games like Dark Souls benefit from letting the player figure out everything on their own, E.Y.E. suffers tremendously from it.  Many of the major game mechanics, such as hacking, researching, and even healing, are either hardly explained or not explained at all.  You'll likely have to do a fair bit of Googling to get a good understanding of everything that goes on within the game.Pros:Super interesting atmosphere with a compelling art styleA fair amount of depth in terms of character customization (which is very RPG like)Multiplayer support for up to 32 peopleFun gameplay mechanicsSupport for custom missionsCons:There're only a few actual missions within the gameNot a ton of replay valueCombat's a bit clunkyThe game doesn't explain itself at all, leaving out some very important mechanicsOverall:  6.5/10.  I enjoyed the game, but I'm glad I only paid $2 for it on sale.  Whether or not it's worth the full $10 comes down to the person buying it:  if you're willing to play the game co-op with a friend, the experience could certainly be worth that much.  As a compelling single-player game, though, it falters.  If you're interested in the game, and it's on sale, though, it's a worthwhile purchase.-For those of you who're interested in buying the game, here're some quick tips:-Research the Medkit through the research panel as soon as possible.  To get there, press "B" to bring up your character customization menu, navigate to "Research" at the top of the screen by clicking it, find "Medkit", set "Scientists" to 0, and research.  Once the research has been completed, stopping at an Armory will allow you to add it to your inventory.  The Medkit is one of only two ways to heal yourself in-game, and is an absolute necessity for your success.  The other way of healing, which is available from the start, is "Alchemy", which allows you to convert weapons and ammunition found on the ground into health.Crouching lets your energy regenerate faster.Engage in conversation with the NPCs you come across.  It's almost always either helpful or humorous.When you have a melee weapon equiped, blocking (default:  Right Mouse) allows you to deflect bullets.  If you're struggling to get across an open area, or get near enemies, equip your default sword (you always have a sword in your inventory, bound to 1 by default, but other melee weapons serve the same function) and walk towards the enemy while blocking.  Also, with most ranged weapons you can hold down Right Mouse while sprinting to block, but you can only deflect bullets that hit your weapon.  This is most effective with the Minigun, and only moderately effective with most other weapons.The key to hacking is balancing your shield and attack stats while trying to cripple the enemy's.  Start out by using "Shield" a few times, generally.  The process of getting to the hacking menu is explained in the tutorial.Going into the "Medical" section of the hub area allows you to purchase abilities which can have a tremendous impact on the game.  Cloaking in particular.Reloading causes you to lose all of the ammunition that was in your previous clip.By default, "F" changes fire modes.  On certain weapons, this can unlock a tremendous amount of potential and give you a lot of firepower.  I would recommend that you, however, bind F to "interact", because its default setting of "Enter" is rather inconvenient.  Also, bind the aforementioned "Alchemy" skill to a key as well, because accessing your menu whenever you want to gain health is rather inconvenient.  I chose "X".Certain enemies, including Sentry turrets, are only really vulnerable to weapons which have armor piercing.  I would highly recommend having such a weapon at all times.Bring the Damocles with you on the second mission (not counting the tutorial).  Just do it.(Minor spoiler) In the level that takes place on Mars, all three artifacts are on the surface level.  The area with the Deus Ex (it can spawn in one of two locations in the same general area) is a crossroads that leads to all three of the artifacts, as well as "something else".

												E.Y.E is the most refreshing shooter I have played since vampire the masquerade and S.T.A.L.K.E.RSet in a crapshack cyberpunk world with multiple influences visible to any player this world took me in despite some bad translation and at the time of writing bugs, The source engine is not getting younger but the visual’s it pulls off in this game make me forget its over half a decade old.The game play is almost dues ex like in the multitude of ways you can deal with each situation but more adjusted for modern ways as the shooting is a more viable option than it was in dues ex, I personally chose a cybermancer part hacker part caster no amazing staying power in combat yet I found a multitude of ways to continue progressing through the game world with the tools at hand, such as hacking enemy turrets and the enemies themselves or summoning some clones of myself in order to even the odds in combat.at no point did this game let me down and for the price this game is the next vampire

content:
er 27, 2011
												If someone asked me what an unpolished and uncut diamond would look like if it were a game, this game would be the answer.This game is POTENTIAL INCARNATE. Everything about this game just leaks potential into your brain matter as you play. Definitely not to say this is wasted potential, no, it's just that the game has so much more you could put into it.The story is vague and confusing, and only in the end you might realize what happened if you were paying attention. It doesn't do a good job of really explaining itself, and I would fault it for that. But at the same time the cryptic story fits in with the rest of the game perfectly.The game is set in a time where people who are barely human live in a universe that is barely alive, fighting for reasons that you can't quite discern, while being attacked by monsters that aren't quite real, and every time you think you are getting somewhere, you find yourself reliving the nightmare.If you can get past the difficulty of getting multiplayer co-op to work, you'll find an interesting first person shooter RPG with unique guns and lots of control over how you want to play the game.

At this point you either drop it (and you're a big ♥♥♥♥♥♥) OR YOU HANDLE YOUR FAT BOTTOM to get further into it and you'll find out that this ♥♥♥♥ing game is a ♥♥♥♥ing gem!    Solid Gameplay, satisfying guns, fully customizable Cybernetic implants that gives depth to each types of character build,which changes the way you play the game, no matter if you want to play it as a normal shooter and focus on combat skills, or go for a stealthy approach, or even focus on hacking skills (yes you can hack your way throught the game! YOU CAN EVEN GET HACKED!)   The whole thing takes place in a neon-cyberpunk/Fantasy setting, crossing Blade Runner, Ghost In the Shell, Deus Ex, with little bit of Warhammer 40K. They nailed the atmosphere perfectly!   Only negative points are the unaccessibility (which might turn you off if you're a casual ♥♥♥♥♥) and the weird-♥♥♥ translation (it's actually so bad it gets good) It's also a bit short BUT it has quite a lot of  replayability AND IT HAS CO-OP and Multiplayer.You'll both love it and hate it. It's nothing like what you've ever seen before!

												Lets say, I love this game.Huge RPG elements (story, experience, leveling, store interface,) with good combat mechanics, and an interesting world. Simply put, the type of game I've been waiting for since I was 4.If this game had been made by a highly funded game studio, or with kickstarter-like backing, it would have been absolutely amazing. As is, the over-the-top awesome is shaded by some serious problems. A very steep learning curve, and a truely vile interface take some of the wind out of the game. Add in the occasional random deaths, and the occasional game-breaking bug, and it can be an exercise in rage management.That being said, if a dozen games came out just like this, with different stories and slightly varied mechanics, I would buy them all and play 100+ hours on each.Goods:Fluid combatWell designed/implemented RPG elementsExcellent world/universeBads:Awkward interfaceOccasional awkward bugsLimited tutorialConsistently mediocre translation/language use

content:
y 28, 2014
												What a bizarre game.It runs on the Source engine, so if you know what that is, you know what to expect graphically.  Stylistically, though, the game certainly impresses.  The "cyber-cult" aesthetic provides for an exceptionally interesting atmosphere that serves the game very well.In terms of gameplay, it's a bit clunky, but interesting.  There's a focus on gunplay as the primary mode of combat, but options for melee and espionage exist.  There're also a myriad of powers that're interesting for the most part, although you can generally function fine without them.The game's fairly short, all things considered.  It took me 10.4 hours to complete, which involved completing some of the side missions.  Note that "side missions" aren't like most games, in that they're repeatable and don't progress side stories at all.  Don't expect a variety of NPCs whose demands will send you all over the place, but instead the ability to revisit previously completed campaign missions with a different set of objectives.  There're only 7 campaign missions (not counting the tutorial), but each is fairly lengthy.  The game supports up to 32 people at once, in both co-op and versus modes.  Yes, there's 32 player co-op.E.Y.E.'s biggest problem is its lack of explanation.  While games like Dark Souls benefit from letting the player figure out everything on their own, E.Y.E. suffers tremendously from it.  Many of the major game mechanics, such as hacking, researching, and even healing, are either hardly explained or not explained at all.  You'll likely have to do a fair bit of Googling to get a good understanding of everything that goes on within the game.Pros:Super interesting atmosphere with a compelling art styleA fair amount of depth in terms of character customization (which is very RPG like)Multiplayer support for up to 32 peopleFun gameplay mechanicsSupport for custom missionsCons:There're only a few actual missions within the gameNot a ton of replay valueCombat's a bit clunkyThe game doesn't explain itself at all, leaving out some very important mechanicsOverall:  6.5/10.  I enjoyed the game, but I'm glad I only paid $2 for it on sale.  Whether or not it's worth the full $10 comes down to the person buying it:  if you're willing to play the game co-op with a friend, the experience could certainly be worth that much.  As a compelling single-player game, though, it falters.  If you're interested in the game, and it's on sale, though, it's a worthwhile purchase.-For those of you who're interested in buying the game, here're some quick tips:-Research the Medkit through the research panel as soon as possible.  To get there, press "B" to bring up your character customization menu, navigate to "Research" at the top of the screen by clicking it, find "Medkit", set "Scientists" to 0, and research.  Once the research has been completed, stopping at an Armory will allow you to add it to your inventory.  The Medkit is one of only two ways to heal yourself in-game, and is an absolute necessity for your success.  The other way of healing, which is available from the start, is "Alchemy", which allows you to convert weapons and ammunition found on the ground into health.Crouching lets your energy regenerate faster.Engage in conversation with the NPCs you come across.  It's almost always either helpful or humorous.When you have a melee weapon equiped, blocking (default:  Right Mouse) allows you to deflect bullets.  If you're struggling to get across an open area, or get near enemies, equip your default sword (you always have a sword in your inventory, bound to 1 by default, but other melee weapons serve the same function) and walk towards the enemy while blocking.  Also, with most ranged weapons you can hold down Right Mouse while sprinting to block, but you can only deflect bullets that hit your weapon.  This is most effective with the Minigun, and only moderately effective with most other weapons.The key to hacking is balancing your shield and attack stats while trying to cripple the enemy's.  Start out by using "Shield" a few times, generally.  The process of getting to the hacking menu is explained in the tutorial.Going into the "Medical" section of the hub area allows you to purchase abilities which can have a tremendous impact on the game.  Cloaking in particular.Reloading causes you to lose all of the ammunition that was in your previous clip.By default, "F" changes fire modes.  On certain weapons, this can unlock a tremendous amount of potential and give you a lot of firepower.  I would recommend that you, however, bind F to "interact", because its default setting of "Enter" is rather inconvenient.  Also, bind the aforementioned "Alchemy" skill to a key as well, because accessing your menu whenever you want to gain health is rather inconvenient.  I chose "X".Certain enemies, including Sentry turrets, are only really vulnerable to weapons which have armor piercing.  I would highly recommend having such a weapon at all times.Bring the Damocles with you on the second mission (not counting the tutorial).  Just do it.(Minor spoiler) In the level that takes place on Mars, all three artifacts are on the surface level.  The area with the Deus Ex (it can spawn in one of two locations in the same general area) is a crossroads that leads to all three of the artifacts, as well as "something else".

er 27, 2011
												If someone asked me what an unpolished and uncut diamond would look like if it were a game, this game would be the answer.This game is POTENTIAL INCARNATE. Everything about this game just leaks potential into your brain matter as you play. Definitely not to say this is wasted potential, no, it's just that the game has so much more you could put into it.The story is vague and confusing, and only in the end you might realize what happened if you were paying attention. It doesn't do a good job of really explaining itself, and I would fault it for that. But at the same time the cryptic story fits in with the rest of the game perfectly.The game is set in a time where people who are barely human live in a universe that is barely alive, fighting for reasons that you can't quite discern, while being attacked by monsters that aren't quite real, and every time you think you are getting somewhere, you find yourself reliving the nightmare.If you can get past the difficulty of getting multiplayer co-op to work, you'll find an interesting first person shooter RPG with unique guns and lots of control over how you want to play the game.

er 3, 2014
												This game is a hard game to review. I love almost everything about this game from the surreal cyberpunk atmosphere to the sick sense of humor expressed through character actions and dialogue.Unfortunately, it isn't wrong to say this game is incomplete.It is complete as far as the developers are concerned, but it lacks a proper tutorial system, the game is generally riddled with bugs, the level design can be confusing and sometimes monotonous, and the story is utterly devoid of a conclusion. This game is not for the impatient. You really have to be willing to experiment and explore to thoroughly enjoy this game.All of that said, if you have the right mindset and a couple of good friends to play with this game can be a blast. The story is deep and is very good overall, but it can be confusing and difficult to follow. The upgrades and leveling system can be very rewarding and the powers and abilities are very useful in certain situations. And if you have enough friends this game supports 32 player coop, so thats pretty fun.

												The game's pretty fun, there are lots of ways you can take out your enemy, by shooting, by hacking, by hitting with melee weapons, by blasting with psi powers, etc.Despite what people say, this game isn't stable... it's liable to crashes, sometimes the multiplayer bugs out, the ranking system sticks to the first rank you attain and doesn't upgrade further (besides the Eqillibrium ranks). Some of the achevements don't work. The stealth system isn't much good unless your have a cloak upgrade. Some of the enemies are overpowered. There are fatal wounds which forever affect your stats, which can be pretty annoying (especially for those who are focusing their skill points on single skills to earn ranks).Other than all that, it's a fun and challenging game. I highly recommend you play the demo first before buying the full game, just to see what it's like.

												-Serious Review-I would like to say that before you say anything... i'm gonna review this game as a "coop experience" instead of a Singleplayer one... this game has been promoted to have a very good coop and that's why i got it ( if you will say that i have to play it SP... i think this is a "borderlands" type of game, where if you play it solo you'll get really REALLY bored).... But the coop experience to this day is ♥♥♥♥, its unplayable... Not even with the fastest internet or fastest rig a good server can be hosted... if you're going to get it for the coop PLEASE BE AWARE THAT ITS NEARLY IMPOSSIBLE.Since i couldn't complete the game and i'm not interested in complete it i'll point out what it's worth of this game:+ The level design is amazing , the only con to this is that almost all of the levels are really confusive. although it's meant to be explored you can get lost REALLY easily+ Some designs although just mix cyberpunk with medieval are really good+ Plausible gunplay+ kind of plausible melee fight+ Interesting hacking minigame... Simplistic but fun, the only con is that if you don't do it very good or you're not in the mood for hacking it will get REALLY frustrating.+ 5/10 soundtrack... some are good ... others are REALLY innecesary.- The enemies in this game ( all of them) feel bland. really nothing to offer, even the cyberdemon monster type it's really uninteresting to fight ( it's so op too... well this reminds me of Doom some how lololol)- REALLY BAD VOICE ACTING ... even Far Cry voice acting is better (believe me)- lack of tutorial or explanations about the gameplay features ( all of them are in a list of minivideos... and even the minivideo list doesn't cover much of the core gameplay)- REALLY IMPOSSIBLE MULTIPLAYER I DON'T EVEN RECOMMEND ( YES THIS INCLUDE THE MOTHER♥♥♥♥ING COOP EXPLANATION I PUT).- Really bad story, narrative, Everything... THE GAME DOESNT EVEN MAKE SENSE... DONT EVEN TRY TO MAKE SENSE OUT OF IT AS OTHER REVIEWS SAYS.I was going to put a hand down... but in the end at least the concept idea of the game its interesting... this game is a game you have to make a run and forget about it... don't even try to get a replay out of it... play it solo , finish it... and boom. end it... you're not missing much.i'd get this game if it's 3-0.99 dollars... that's what is worth... don't waste more.if you want to waste your time exploring a bit or get away with a "different game type" ...  i recommend it.BUT if you want to play this game in coop, make metagame coop with your friends, do the coop missions and all of that stuff: DON'T.glhf.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
7, 2015
												>*"You gain Brouzouf* intensifes*In all seriousness though, I'll admit I was skeptical about E.Y.E to begin with, but once you get into it and trim away the fat, its true colors show. When playing this, it felt like someone put Ghost in the Shell, Blade Runner, Shadow Warrior, Metal Gear Rising, Dishonored and Terminator into a blender, made a game out of it, and this was the result. A bit rough around the edges, the game doesn't do a good job of explaining itself too well since it just throws you in and expects you to make sense of what's happening. Basically, there's a war going between the human race and psychic aliens and the human race is losing. You're the lone survivor of an E.Y.E tactical force group and your job is find a way to defeat the aliens. Unlike other games like Dark Souls or Transistor which start off enigmative but provides some context as to what's happening without spoiling anything, EYE keeps to itself and doesn't share much about what about its world is about, and the complicated matters between the two in-game factions and the mediocre writing doesn't help either. Despite this, it has quite a lot of interesting lore and and the concept is reminisint of games like Half-Life 2 and System Shock 2, so I'll give it that. The gameplay is interesting for the most part, but the lack of an actual tutorial level and having to watch 20-something in-game tutorial videos to actually understand how the mechanics and controls work is slightly frustrating. Character creation can also be a bit enigmative to use since none of the mechanics are explained at that point and by the sounds of it, the devs are just expecting you to pick DNA strands based on what race names sound the coolest. The gameplay itself is solid though. Being able to dual-wield katanas and using a minigun to blast through hordes of enemies at a time is very satisfying, and all the weapons feel fantastic to use, since they all have some nice power to them. The stealth mechanic is broken though, so don't even try it.I'd say the game qualifies as a flawed masterpiece and one of those hidden gems in indie gaming, but do your research beforehand and don't go into expecting a stellar story or one of those GotY stories. It's either a hit or a miss, based on your preference.

content:
, 2015
-Quick Review-E.Y.E: Divine Cybermancy is an indie cyberpunk first person shooter RPG developed by Streum On Studio, you will find many dark themes within this game, and alternative story paths that you can take. E.Y.E: Divine Cybermancy was released in 2011 and uses the Source Engine.-Detailed breakdown review-Story:  You start Divine Cybermancy by jumping right into the game and you find yourself a part of a complex story of a war between two main factions: Secreta Secretorum and the federation. You're allegance has already been set to help the Secreta Secretorum, however your loyalties are caught between two important figures: Commander Rimanah and your Mentor.There are a number of secrets and alternative choices you can make throughout the game to different endings, some of which let you chose different factions.Game Play: Just thinking "how do I explain the game play of this game" gives me a headache. That probably should speak volumes for itself. The controls utilize standard FPS controls, and then throw in some "Jedi Force Powers". You start the game out with very little explanation about what any of these skills do, you're expected to figure them out for yourself.There are 3 status bars that you need to watch: health, energy, and ethics. Obviously, once you run out of health, you die. Energy is used for your special abilities (Force Powers). If you run out of the Ethics bar, your character go insane for a little bit, firing uncontrollably and the screen gets really blurry.Even after playing through this game, and looking up information on it, I'm still not 100% sure what everything does. Safe to say, the game is a mess... but it was a fun mess to play for a few hours.Achievements: After 28 hours of gameplay, I have 42/100 achievements. At this point, fellow achiever should be saying "ouch". Most of the achievements are based on RNG (Random Number Generator).There's a whole list of achievements for "kill this type of character". While that might look easy and simple enough, there is a chance table for if the creature you kill was actually that "class". To make matters more difficult only certain creatures can be certain classes.There's also achievements for getting different objectives or quests within the game, different weapons, kills with different weapons, learning new spells/force-moves and other misc. achievements.In other words, if you're hoping to get all the achievements, brace yourself for farming against the RNG-gods.Price: E.Y.E: Divine Cybermancy is priced at $9.99, I personally picked up my copy of the game while it was on a 90% off sale. I recommend others do the same. However, Streum On Studio is an indie company, so they definitely can use the support.Conclusion: Now we come to the conclusion, and the real question is "Atratzu, did you enjoy playing the game?" And the answer is "yes, yes I did." While the game is complicated, messy, and at times unforgiving, I enjoyed playing this game, and will probably return to it and try to mop up more achievements.

0, 2016
												Game that requires insane amount of patience to play it properly. Early hours will be confusing as hell but once you get past it and finally start to learn the game bit more, you'll find lot of fun in here. It's one of those games that will stick in your head forever because how strange and how atmospheric this game is. I would totally recommend anyone who has patience and willing to read a bit.Oh and this game has the best hacking minigame ever.

content:
19, 2013
												I'm convinced that this game is a golden nugget of genious encrusted in a thick coating of dried, stale (but still warm) feces.The gunplay is solid. The game mechanisms are pretty indepth for your average shooter. The UI is cluttered as all hell. The setting is trippy. The translation is poor. The art design is full whack.Overall it gives off a vibe of great potential that's weighed down by questionable level and game design (the challenge mostly being shootan waves and waves of endlessly respawning enemies) and just a general blurry haze of 'what the ♥♥♥♥ is even going on, what am I doing, where am I going, why am I going over there, what the ♥♥♥♥ is that, do I shoot it, yes I do because it's shooting at me, okay now we're here, what did I even just do.'And it's french!

content:
y 11, 2014
												This game has been very thought out and you need to take your time and pay attention. Since it is only a couple dollars right now I would suggest that anyone get it to try it out. Otherwise be warned that it is a challenge game that requires you to count your bullets and think tactically. Also if you are motion sick sensitive, do not get this game. Ontop of the game having insanely difficult challenges it makes it even harder to kill the enemy when you are trying to shoot them. Also do not use the sniper rifles cause getting out of the scope view takes forever. I have died a lot because of the scope view, even though I needed to snipe out some enemies in order to continue on.

10, 2011
												Nice familiar shooter with good rpg elements in a mysterious setting. Rewards multiple playthroughs by revealing new bits of the story each time. It has its flaws, and it could really use a patch, but the gameplay shines once you get past the unfamiliar UI and wonky save/death system. Would love to play co op )

content:
, 2014
												An exceptional, standout action-shooter rpg, with a few quirks, brilliant art style, and a unique vision.The gameplay is punchy, colorful, and varied enough that I find myself continuing to come back.This game is heavy with customization which will create a bump in the road for some, but once you get over this initial (5 minute) hump of the menu system, you'll have yourself onto a rocking ride set in an intriguing universe.Combat seamlessly mixes GUNS, SWORDS, and PSYCHIC POWERS, while fusing with machinery.Its a lethal combination that can be crafted to your personal taste.Hacking, Machine control, rambo-style play, stealth, super-human abilities... its all here. Whatever you want.This game sets itself apart in art style, excellent combat, nonlinear branching story (with meaningful plot points the player can influence), and a setting/mood that REALLY takes you somewhere else.If you take time to pick up the snippets of story and explore a bit you'll enjoy it more.The ambient-orchestral soundtrack is peerless for games in this category.The customization is deep and allows you to truly craft any character style you can think of.The fact that this was an indie game made for less than $1m is stunning. The production values for a game of this type are rather high.While lacking in extensive voice overs, I found that the quirky dialogue and text based story actually added literary charm from the game and did not detract from the main idea.Excellent gunplay, co-op, deathmatch, cool characters, and meaningful branching story choices will create a sense of intrigue, deep moods, and powerful action.The only thing that would stop you from enjoying this is You are tossed into the game and expected to figure it out. Please take the time (5 minutes tops) to do so. You won't regret it.For ten bucks (I got it for $5 steam sale), its a steal. It's been almost 3 years since this game came out and I'm still playing it.Somehow it just hits on all of the right notes.Play it. And if you do, message me for a multiplayer game.Good job. I hope to see more updates from this studio.

y 12, 2014
												I love this game for it's multiple objectives, weapon selection, easy achievements, interesting story and the really cool hack menu. I hate this game for it's bad english translation, confusing placement of controls and its frustrating gameplay. For 10 dollars, this game is worth checking out. But when i bought it on sale for 2 dollars, this game was a must-have.Definitely recommended to fans of RPG/FPS.4.0/5

content:
25, 2015
												What a wierd game, actually the perfect way to describe this game is Alien, the way the characters talk to you, the game world, the bad translation, the inhuman interface, the art, the fact that feels like a Half Life 2 mod, ect. But I just have a blast with this game, is like Deus Ex on crack, the objetive of the game always change and is made with coop in mind, the shooting feels awesome, the hacking feels awesome, the stealth sucks, but the psi power rocks, if you find this review hard to follow is because the game is also hard to describe.But in the end, you like Cyberpunk and Warhammer 40k, and think that both make a perfect couple you would love this game, you will be able to pass his hard learning curve and horrible interface, and enjoy one of most obscure FPS/RPG.
